result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Lee King

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Richard Lee King.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial.  Defendant was not produced.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court vacated jury trial and set a plea hearing date. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a. Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed:  Jury Instructions.

Attorney Annette E Rauch in court, defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court will hold plea hearing at 8:30 am on the scheduled jury trial date.  State will file an order to produce.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial remains scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Annette E Rauch in court, defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case in court for a Status Conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 6-17-2022 and all responses to be filed by 7-15-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
Signed and Filed:  Order to View Discovery.

Defendant Richard Lee King in court with Attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Richard Lee King in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a signed order to allow the defendant to view e-discovery.  Court will sign order.  Case adjourned for status in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Proposed Order to View Discovery.
Received and Filed:  Stipulation to Allow Defendant to View E-Discovery.
Received and Filed:  Motion to Allow CJF Resident to View Discovery.
DECLINED.
Received and Filed. Proposed Order to View Discovery

Attorney Annette E Rauch in court, defendant Richard Lee King not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case is in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a scheduling conference. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard Lee King in court with Attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Richard Lee King in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 016927,
Payable Number: 986503,
Receipt Number: 22RP006805,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Richard Lee King in court by video with Attorney Ashley Fard who appears in person.  Defendant Richard Lee King in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense requests an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard Lee King in court with attorney Thomas R. Reed.  Defendant Richard Lee King in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard Lee King appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
